Class CubePainter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • CubePainter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

    public class CubePainter
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Copyright 2017, Shoumyo Chakravorti, All rights reserved.

    Licensed under the MIT License.

    The CubePainter class defines and takes input from all components which the user can interact with. The CubePainter class has two unique solution modes: "Text Scramble" and "Color Selection".

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Shoumyo Chakravorti
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • CubePainter

        public CubePainter()
        Initializes all elements of the CubePainter JPanel with which the user can interact. This includes all buttons, sliders, and text fields.

    • Method Detail

      • resetCubeInputs

        public void resetCubeInputs()
        Resets the colors inputed in color selection mode to the colors of a cube in its solved state.

      • initializeComponents

        public void initializeComponents()
        Initializes all the buttons, sliders, combo boxes, and text fields for the user to interact with. Helper methods for constructor.

      • getPreferredSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
        Returns the preferred dimensions of the CubePainter as a Dimension object.
        Overrides:
        getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Returns:
        default dimensions of CubePainter

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the JPanel. Upon initialization, paints the buttons, sliders, and text field which the user can interact with. When repaint() is called, the main changes that will be visible are changes to the cube, moves to be performed, and moves already performed. For painting the cube, this method invokes the paintComponent() method from Cube to retrieve all colors, and after painting those colors, paints an outline around the cubies.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • resetScramble

        public void resetScramble(java.lang.String s)
        Resets the scramble that is to be applied on the cube based on the input. Determines the moves to be performed to solve the cube as well.
        Parameters:
        s: - the scramble to be applied

      • resetScrambleByColorInputs

        public void resetScrambleByColorInputs()
        After the user inputs their desired colors in color selection mode, pressing the setInputs button will invoke this method, acquiring the required moves necessary to solve the cube. The cube is restored back to the scrambled state after the solution moves are acquired.

      • performNextMove

        public void performNextMove()
        After updating the phase (if necessary), performs the next move in the String movesToPerform and updates movesPerformed.

      • updateElements

        public void updateElements()
        Updates the UI elements that the user can interact with depending on the current mode and whether a solution is being played.

      • updateMode

        public void updateMode(java.lang.String str)
        Updates the mode to either text scramble or color selection mode based on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        str - the mode to change to

      • setInSolution

        public void setInSolution(boolean inSoln)
        Sets inSolution to the parameter, determining whether a solution is to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        inSoln - whether mode should be switched to being in a solution or not

      • updatePhase

        public void updatePhase()
        Updates the current phase of the solution as necessary Respective stages of the solution w.r.t the phase variable 0 = sunflower 1 = whiteCross 2 = whiteCorners 3 = secondLayer 4 = yellowCross 5 = OLL 6 = PLL
